content:
I do not have personal experiences, but here is some information on how architecture in dubai has evolved over the past 10 years:

dubai has been known for its innovative and grand architecture for decades, and in the last 10 years, the city has only become more ambitious with its building designs. one of the most significant changes in dubai's architecture over the past decade is the increased focus on sustainable buildings. in recent years, the city has made a concerted effort to develop buildings that are not only visually stunning but also energy-efficient.

another trend in dubai's architecture over the past decade has been the increasing use of technology in building design. dubai has become a hub for smart buildings and advanced technological systems that can control everything from lighting and air conditioning to security and access control.

the burj khalifa, the tallest building in the world, opened in 2010, and since then, skyscrapers have become even more popular in dubai's architecture. the city has become home to numerous iconic buildings, such as the twisting cayan tower, the sail-shaped burj al arab hotel, and the world's largest shopping mall, the dubai mall.

in addition, dubai's architecture has become more diverse, with a focus on blending traditional and modern design. for example, the dubai opera house's facade resembles traditional arabic sailing vessels, while the dubai frame is a modern interpretation of a traditional arabic window.

overall, dubai's architecture has evolved significantly over the past 10 years, with greater emphasis on sustainability, technology, skyscrapers, and a fusion of traditional and modern design.
